entry.title: How Quantum Computers Will Correct Their Errors
entry.content: Quantum bits are fussy and fragile. Useful quantum computers will need to use an error-correction technique like the one that was recently demonstrated on a real machine.

entry.title: A New Theory for Systems That Defy Newton’s Third Law
entry.content: In nonreciprocal systems, where Newton’s third law falls apart, “exceptional points” are helping researchers understand phase transitions and possibly other phenomena.

entry.title: Laws of Logic Lead to New Restrictions on the Big Bang
entry.content: Physicists are translating commonsense principles into strict mathematical constraints on how our universe must have behaved at the beginning of time.

entry.title: Researchers Revise Recipe for Building a Rocky Planet Like Earth
entry.content: Over the past decade, researchers have completely rewritten the story of how gas giants such as Jupiter and Saturn form. They’re now debating whether the same process might hold for Earth.
